environment_get_variable: This function returns the value (a string) of the environment variable with the given name (also a string). You can get the available environment variables on macOS and Ubuntu (Linux) by typing "<tt>env</tt>" into the terminal app, and for information on Windows environment variables, if you are using the command prompt then type "<tt>echo %PATH%</tt>", and using PowerShell it's "<tt>ls env</tt>". Note that on both macOS and Ubuntu (Linux) the "HOME" environment variable will return the "<tt>~/</tt>" path which maps to "<tt>/Users/<username></tt>" on macOS and "<tt>/home/<username></tt>" on Ubuntu (Linux).
NOTE: This function is for Windows, macOS and Ubuntu (Linux) only.
